page.title: 08HEALTH IN THE LYTHE AREA
page.content: {HEALTH;-} There is no doctor or surgery in the village,but there is a Group Practice and surgery at Sandsend about one mile distant.If the patient is too ill to attend the surgery, home visits can be arranged.If a patient needs further investigation he can be referred to a consultant at Whitby hospital or at the area hospital at Scarborough.More specialised cases are referred to Hull, Leeds, Middlesbrough or Newcastle.Transportation of visiting relatives is an immense problem and causes much individual hardship. Also operating in the district is the Community Health Service based at Whitby Hospital.This service looks after the needs of the school children,as well as pre and post natal care. It runs parallel to the service provided by the doctors..
